doc.after: The earliest text on library operations Advice on Establishing a Library was published in 1627 by French librarian and scholar Gabriel Naud Naud wrote prolifically producing works on many subjects including politics religion history and the supernatural He put into practice all the ideas put forth in Advice when given the opportunity to build and maintain the library of Cardinal Jules Mazarin
